node.title: These are the stores that will be closed on Thanksgiving
node.description: More retailers are giving workers the holiday off, although a handful will be open for early Black Friday shopping.

node.title: Waukesha parade victim had previously undiagnosed cancer, husband says
node.description: Jane Kulich was one of the six people killed when Darrell Brooks plowed his SUV into the holiday parade.

node.title: Southern California under fire warnings amid strong Santa Ana winds
node.description: Residents are encouraged to take caution with activities that could begin fires.

node.title: ‘Bruised’ Review: It’s a Hard-Knock Life
node.description: Halle Berry stars as a mixed martial arts fighter staging a comeback in her directorial debut.

node.title: ‘’Twas the Fight Before Christmas’ Review: A Not-So-Silent Night
node.description: This documentary recounts how an Idaho man filed a discrimination lawsuit after his neighbors refused to let him host an annual Christmas light extravaganza.

node.title: ‘Burning’ Review: Pulling the Fire Alarm in Australia
node.description: A new documentary looks at the visceral impact of wildfires and climate change on the country, from its beleaguered people to sickly koalas.

node.title: ‘Writing With Fire’ Review: Speaking Truth to Power
node.description: This rousing documentary follows the reporters of India’s only all-women news outlet as they pivot to digital journalism while battling personal and political challenges.

node.title: Explosion Outside School Kills 8 in Somalia’s Capital
node.description: The latest in a series of deadly attacks comes as the country is gripped by election instability and by a drought that threatens 2.6 million people.

node.title: Are Stores Open on Thanksgiving 2021? Opening Hours for Walmart, CVS, Costco and More
node.description: Thanksgiving is a federal holiday, which means many public institutions will be closed so families can come together for the festivities.

node.title: Black Friday COVID Restrictions: What Stores Are Doing To Keep Shoppers Safe
node.description: Many retailers have implemented several COVID-19 safety measures, including mask policies, which have been in place throughout the pandemic.

node.title: 3 men found guilty of murdering Ahmaud Arbery
node.description: Travis McMichael, his father Gregory McMichael and their neighbor William "Roddie" Bryan face sentences of life in prison.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check
node.description: IRS has distributed almost 170 million payments. But hardship remains widespread as the Delta variant spreads.

node.title: No, Ahmaud Arbery's Father Did Not Say 'All Lives Matter'
node.description: Marcus Arbery Sr. spoke outside a Georgia courthouse after three men were convicted of murdering his 25-year-old son.

node.title: Only 1 in 10 Americans Have Had Booster Vaccine as COVID Cases Surge
node.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration and CDC has given all adults the green light to get a booster shot.

node.title: The Car Key of the Future (Is Still in Your Pocket)
node.description: They’re in fobs or on phones, and digital or “smart,” and they can do far more than just open doors and start the engine.

node.title: Rivian’s Electric Truck Is a Cutie and a Beast
node.description: The R1T can haul five tons, conquer brutal off-road trails and sprint to 60 miles an hour in a blink. And about that Camp Kitchen tucked inside …

node.title: Egypt to reopen ancient parade route, the "Avenue of Sphinxes"
node.description: The 1.7-mile-long "Path of God," lined with more than 1,000 sphinx and ram statues, spent centuries buried by the sands of time. But it's about to come back - with all due pomp and ceremony.

node.title: Are the Knicks and Lakers Really Worth $5 Billion?
node.description: Sports franchise valuations are guesses, with few data points for comparison. But prestige franchises like these can defy all calculations.

node.title: Is the Post Office Open on Thanksgiving Day? Hours and Delivery Information Revealed
node.description: Many government offices and some private businesses are closed on Thanksgiving. But is the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) open on the day?

node.title: Internet Backs Woman Refusing to Clean up As Men Watch Thanksgiving Football
node.description: A woman who is sick of doing the Thanksgiving cleanup while men watch football has announced a boycott online—and attracted widespread support.

node.title: Rescuers suspend search after deadly Russian mine fire, with dozens still trapped underground
node.description: Coal dust catches fire in a ventilation shaft at the Listvyazhnaya mine in the snowbound Kemerovo region, filling the underground workplace with smoke, according to authorities.

node.title: Seven accused drug traffickers arrested in Adelaide's south
node.description: Police have seized kilograms of illicit drugs, cash and drug paraphernalia allegedly linked to a southern suburbs drug syndicate.

node.title: Mothers get bail, men remain in custody after group allegedly uses back roads to breach WA border
node.description: Two children are among the group that allegedly crossed into WA from the NT earlier this month in the midst of an COVID-19 outbreak there. The adult men are remanded in custody in Kalgoorlie.

node.title: Solomon Islands unrest jolts Australia's 'Pacific Step-up'
node.description: The great geopolitical contest of the 21st century is playing out on Australia’s doorstep, writes defence correspondent Andrew Greene.

node.title: Astronomers Find Hundreds of New Worlds, Including Unusually Close Saturn-Sized Gas Giants
node.description: The 366 exoplanets were found by an algorithm that searched 800 million images of stars taken by NASA's Kepler Space Telescope in its K2 mission.

node.title: Why Talking Politics at Thanksgiving Might Be a Good Idea
node.description: Many families will hope to avoid talking about politics as they gather together. But while it might feel uncomfortable to debate, it could help heal divisions.

node.title: The History of Thanksgiving: Here's How the American Tradition Began
node.description: The origins of Thanksgiving can be traced back to harvest festivals, when the Pilgrims and Native Americans gave thanks for a bountiful harvest.

node.title: Tired of the East Coast, They Followed Their Hearts to Los Angeles. But Where Would They End Up Living?
node.description: Intent on giving themselves ‘the best shot at being happy with California,’ a young couple tested the rental market, where their money would go further. Here’s what they found.

node.title: The Rise of Psychedelic Retreats
node.description: Even with cause for concern, retreats in countries like Costa Rica and Jamaica, as well as in the United States, have been popping up for more than a decade.
